moves.1. e4 e5: We open up our queens and kingside bishops...
moves.2. Nf3: ...he develops his knight and attacks my pawn...
moves.2... Nc6: ...and I develop mine to defend it.
moves.3. Bc4 Nf6: Now I develop my other knight...
moves.6. c3 Be6: Now I develop my bishop to have more control of the d5 square...
moves.8. Qxb7: Whoops! I didn't see that coming...
moves.8... Rb8: ...so I move my rook out of harm's way. Well I put it on a square covered by my knight...
moves.9. Qa6: ...forcing the queen away from the file.
moves.10... Be7: Now I develop my other bishop...
moves.11. Bb5: ...but as my knight is now under double attack...
moves.11... Bd7: ... I bring back my other bishop...
moves.13. Qxa7: ...and he steals my pawn, which no longer had cover...
moves.13... O-O: ...so I castle out of harm's way...
moves.15... Nf4: I move up my remaining knight...
moves.17. Nd4: He moves his knight out of the bishop's way...
moves.18. Rg1 Bh3: I keep my bishop on the 6th rank, to cover some of the higher squares.
moves.19... Bxa3: ...and exposes his a3-pawn, which I also accept.
moves.21. Rd1 Bxc3+: ...and I remove another pawn to fork the king and d-knight. Why did he resign after this?
